intro: Brathys japonica var. acutisepala, commonly known as the Japanese brathys, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, delicate flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas.
